TO COVER IN-COUNTRY TRAVEL AND RELATED EXPENSES FOR PROGRAMMING AND OUTREACH IN ISLAMABAD, LAHORE, KARACHI, PESHAWAR, GILGIT, HUNZA & SKARDU. PROGRAMMING WILL INCLUDE FILM FESTIVAL, CAPACITY BUILDING WORKSHOPS, PANEL DISCUSSIONS, AND MEDIA ENGAGEMENTS.

THE PROGRAM AIMS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY AND VOLUME OF ENVIRONMENTAL REPORTING IN PAKISTAN, ULTIMATELY CONTRIBUTING TO INCREASED PUBLIC AWARENESS AND BETTER-INFORMED DECISION-MAKING ON ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES.

TO PROVIDE TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES TO EXILED AFGHAN JOURNALISTS IN PAKISTAN AND TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF AFGHAN JOURNALISTS AND ENABLE THEM TO REPORT ON ISSUES RELATED TO AFGHANISTAN AND THE REGION.
TO PROVIDE ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT TO LINCOLN CORNERS IN ISLAMABAD AND LAHORE CONSULAR DISTRICTS.

THE PROJECT AIMS TO MITIGATE THE IMPACT OF CLIMATE CHANGE AND REDUCE AIR POLLUTION BY DEVELOPING AN URBAN FOREST AND BY BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS AND YOUTH THROUGH A CBDRM APPROACH.

TO BUILD CAPACITY THROUGH ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND ADVOCACY, RESEARCH AND DATA SHARING, STUDENT AND FACULTY EXCHANGES, STARTUP GRANTS, AND SUSTAINABLE URBAN AND PUBLIC POLICY PLANNING TO COMBAT AND MITIGATE CLIMATE CHANGE IN PAKISTAN.

TO DEVELOP IMPROVEMENTS TO CURRICULUM, CONDUCT COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH, AND PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENTS THAT DEVELOPS CLIMATE RESILIENCE RESEARCH AND EDUCATION CAPACITY, AND STRENGTHEN EACH PAKISTANI HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTION.

THE PROJECT BUILDS UPON THE INCLUSION OF YOUNG WOMEN IN THE ENTREPRENEURIAL ECOSYSTEM OF PAKISTAN. THE CORE AIM OF THE PROJECT IS TO DRIVE CHANGE THROUGH EMPOWERING WOMEN ENTREPRENEURS IN QUETTA AND TRANSFORMING THEM INTO EFFECTIVE INCOME GENERATORS.

TO ENABLE GENDER PARITY FOR FEMALE ENVIRONMENTALISTS IN CLIMATE CHANGE AND TO BUILD A PAKISTANI WOMEN UNIVERSITY CLIMATE CHANGE CONSORTIUM WHICH WILL DEVELOP PAKISTANI CAPACITY TO ADAPT TO AND MITIGATE CLIMATE CHANGES.

TO EQUIP WOMEN UNIVERSITIES IN PAKISTAN TO BETTER TEACH, CONDUCT RESEARCH, AND DEVELOP WOMEN ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE PRACTITIONERS TO EMPOWER A NEW GENERATION OF WOMEN LED ENVIRONMENTAL EFFORTS TO MITIGATE THE IMPACTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE IN PAKISTAN.

THIS PROJECT AIMS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF QUALIFIED WOMEN JOURNALISTS AND REPORTERS IN SINDH AND BALOCHISTAN THROUGH PROFESSIONAL TRAINING AND THE CREATION OF A FORMAL SUPPORT NETWORK FOR WOMEN JOURNALISTS.
PROJECT WILL RESTORE AND PROMOTE FIVE MONUMENTS AT LAHORE FORT.  PRESERVATION OF THESE MONUMENTS WILL SHOWCASE PAKISTAN'S PLURALISTIC PAST, AND PROMOTE RELIGIOUS TOLERANCE AND INCLUSION.
